Wine List
FIRST
c l a s s
BRITISH AIRWAYS

CHAMPAGNE
Laurent Pennier, Brut, 1985
Although founded in 1812 Laurent Perrier only became an easily
recognised champagne name in the 1960's. This was due to huge
expansion led by its current owners, the de Nonancourt family.
Investment in new fermentation tanks, the purchase of substantial
vineyards and the establishment of long term contracts with some
of the best growers in the region have allowed the cellar master
to establish a much respected house style.
Laurent Perrier champagnes seem to possess a strikingly clear,
bright taste - slightly austere yet scintillating and of
very reliable quality.
OR
CHAMPAGNE
Charles Heidsieck
Charles Heidsieck, Brut Millesimé,
1985
The Grande Marque house of Charles Heidsieck was founded in
1851 by the legendary "Champagne Charlie" - the extrovert but
reckless Charles-Camille Heidsieck. His pioneering spirit in
exporting his wines has ensured that Charles Heidsieck
is known throughout the world.
Daniel Thibault, the chefs des caves, is a master blender. His 1985
vintage champagne is a delightful mix of Pinot and Chardonnay
grapes from the very best vineyard sites. It has a good, positive
colour, a fragrant aroma and a lovely uplifting flavour.
SPECIA
PECTED
WHITE BURGUNDY
CHABLIS GRAND CRU
Chablis Grand Cre. 1991
William Fevre
Grand Cru Chablis has a dimension that is not apparent in other
styles of Chablis. It has more weight of fruit and a full bodied,
mouth-filling flavour that defies traditional descriptions
such as steely or flinty.
William Fèvre has never been afraid of submitting his wines to the
rigours of oak ageing. He is one of, if not the, largest vineyard
owners in the tiny Grand Cru district and this wine is a blend from
his vineyards within that area. A positive oaky flavour, heaps of
fruit and the calming influence of a little bottle age
have produced a stunner.
ALSACE
ALSACE GRAND CRU
Порії
RAND DE TERCKHEIM 1989
1989 Sewungtraminex Grand bre
"Brand de Turckheim"
Dopff au Moulin
The Dopff family settled in the beautiful medieval town of
Riquewihr, in the Haut-Rhin region of Alsace, in the sixteenth
century and their expertise in wine-making has been
growing ever since.
The Gewurztraminer grape is the best expression of Alsace wines
and this, from the Grand Cru vineyard "Brand" above the village of
Turckheim, is a true classic - ripe and powerful in fruit yet stylish
and very elegant - certainly a wine to ponder.
ELECTED
